title: Type Detective
description:
Create a program that analyzes and reports the types of different variables.

Given these variables:
- name = "Python"
- version = 3.11
- is_popular = True
- users = 1000000
- features = ['simple', 'powerful']

For each variable, print:
- The variable name
- Its value
- Its type (use type())

Format: name: Python (type: <class 'str'>)
starterCode:
# Define variables
name = "Python"
version = 3.11
is_popular = True
users = 1000000
features = ['simple', 'powerful']

# Print type information for each variable
# TODO: Print in format: variable_name: value (type: <class 'type'>)
solution:
# Define variables
name = "Python"
version = 3.11
is_popular = True
users = 1000000
features = ['simple', 'powerful']

# Print type information for each variable
print(f"name: {name} (type: {type(name)})")
print(f"version: {version} (type: {type(version)})")
print(f"is_popular: {is_popular} (type: {type(is_popular)})")
print(f"users: {users} (type: {type(users)})")
print(f"features: {features} (type: {type(features)})")
hints: Use type() function to get variable type
